intro: Gaura podocarpa, commonly known as the mountain gaura, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is typically narrow and grass-like, with a soft, silvery underside. Gaura podocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
